cyclone.name: ELSA
cyclone.current_location: about 30 mi E of Havana, Cuba
cyclone.trajectory: Turning north-northwest tonight, then north on Tuesday night and accelerating north-northeast along the U.S. Southeast and Mid-Atlantic coast late Wednesday through Friday
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Florida Big Bend / west-central Florida coast (near or just north of Tampa)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Tropical Storm Watches extend west of the Ochlockonee River FL to Indian Pass FL; no watches posted north of Florida at this time
weather_observation.warning_coast: Tropical Storm Warnings cover Florida Keys and Florida west coast from Flamingo to Ochlockonee River; no warnings for Mid-Atlantic coast
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire U.S. East Coast from Florida Keys to New England, including coastal Georgia, the Carolinas, and southeast Virginia
weather_observation.wind: Low chance (≤9%) of tropical-storm-force winds; breezy conditions likely Friday with gusts 25–35 kt
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected; minor tidal departures (<1 ft) possible during onshore flow Friday
weather_observation.rainfall: 1–3 inches with isolated amounts up to 5 inches possible Wednesday night–Friday, producing localized ponding and minor flooding
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated tornado threat cannot be ruled out Thursday night–Friday as Elsa’s remnants pass nearby
